text: oh thanks. I didn't see your message. Well that was for a project that should be finnished in one day (integration, templating etc). So I didn't loose time trying to do this.

Hi. I had blocked in my robots.txt the pages with cHash and id?= since it doesn't make sense for SEO purposes to index those pages. I received a list of errors in the Google Search Console. I found that the links that creates error are links with hstc_ and a lot of parameters at the end. As far as I understand those links are created when someone comes to our site from another site and both sites have the HubSpot tracking code installed. Then HubSpot treats our domain as external and add the parameters in order to keep track of the users.

the links with problems are generated with the pattern "<http://www.domain.com|www.domain.com>". If I check the list of the domains in the HubSpot settings, I see that the target domain is "<http://domain.com|domain.com>" (without www. ) and in the list of the additionnal domains there's only <http://domain.com|domain.com>, not the www version. Should I add the www version in this list or change the target domain? The site is external. There's only some landingpages in HubSpot

You could also just add a modifier class to the first posts
<div class="blog-item {% if !last_page_num %} {if loop.index = 0} blog-item--large {% endif %} {% endif %}">
My issue is the shows 5 bit, I still want to show 6 to make the first page look neat
Then go with the modifier class for the first item
Hi is it possible to hide the post filter on the single Blog Post Page?
I’ve always been fascinated by the psychology of UI UX seems interesting

hello all, client decided to run a pagespeed insights test on a `.<http://hs-sites.com|hs-sites.com>` domain where we are building out the new site.  how differently (if at all) would the results be vs the live production domain once it is moved over?
what do you mean exactly?

Hi dennis, thanks for reaching out. I have found a fix for this. The post filter was showing on both sites: Listing and single. But i just wanted to have the filter  on the listing  page not the single blog post
cool.  glad you figured it out :slightly_smiling_face:

great question.

1 big thing to check - are you seeing the css/js files minified and combined, also if you inspect the page - go to the network tab, find the actual page in the list, check if it’s showing cloudflare caching headers

specific one to look for I think is `cache-control`
I haven’t specifically looked to compare hs-sites and live, but those would be the first things I look at
minified - yes.  looking for the cloudflare caching now
yep
cloudflare server

hmmm. I would say they should be pretty comparable then. That said it’s highly possible that HubSpot does some server-side optimizations that we can’t easily see.

The server side items unfortunately don’t tend to account for much in Google Page Speed.

Here’s something you may be able to do to bring up the score, enable “move jquery to footer” in account settings
Not sure i understand!
yeah. did that. and that increased by 13 points.  (why is that not default)
It was supposed to be for new sites but they apparently forgot about it

But i don’t want our website stats (visits, time on page, etc) to gather data from the partner website, so i assume i don’t want our tracking code on their website.
But without our tracking code, would the form work?
the pagescore is about 20 points higher on this dev site than there current site :face_with_rolling_eyes:

the form code is not the same as the tracking code, you do not need to have the tracking code in order to embed a form on a persons site.

The form accounts for stats related to itself(form submissions, views etc.), not site wide stats, that would be pointless
Great, perfect!
Same for CTA i assume?
cant wait til this is real: <https://twitter.com/szynszyliszys/status/1126261253280649216>
well that’s good
yea saw that. was excited. also interested in HTML portals
yes, the CTA only tracks stats related to itself
yeah.  that is pretty sweet
Perfect, thank you !
I for one am ready for all of the Portal and Portal 2 jokes to arise.
ha!

I will admit though. I don’t really see very many real benefits to portals vs iFrames. Maybe there’s a bunch of security advantages I don’t understand though.

Otherwise UI wise it just seems like an iframe you click and it zooms full screen and changes your URL
i bet there is some security love in there

Hi everyone, we changed the domain from a blog from <http://blog.domain.de|blog.domain.de> to <http://domain.de/blog|domain.de/blog> ... The problem i am facing : i lost the Publishing dates that have been there previously on the listing view. Does anyone know how i can restore them?
When you moved the blog, did create a new one at /blog and move posts over there?
yes
there are redirects in place i think
i would see if you can check in the restore for the pubilished dates
how did you move them over? API?
with the domain tool
changed the primary url of the blog domain
this area right?
yes
that shouldnt have updated the published date, i would submit a support ticket to HS and let them know
ok  good thanks
anyone familiar with how to cut off text highlight and copy?
Can't seem to find where this is occurring in my site
`|truncate` but idk what you mean by highlight and copy
Currently, I can't highlight any text on my website (<https://www.benefit.info>). I am trying to figure out what is preventing me from doing it.
highlight or select as if I want to copy and paste
nm, figured it out ::selection
It just hid the selection highlight
apparently, google fonts `font-display` is real now!  instead of `font-display`, use `display` <https://www.zachleat.com/web/google-fonts-display/>

yeah, these are false alarms. We're improving our communication systems to try and improve notifications and communications... ironically in setting up the system it triggered some (test) messages to go out. Ignore this round of errors, sorry for the scare/confusion. :pray:
We haven't forgotten about moving jquery to footer to all new portals. It's just a little complicated
Sorry that it is complicated
I still don't understand.  Why not check the box ...
Easy to forget. And doing it after the fact can break a poorly done site
Sigh...it is like supporting ie
Again, I understand the issues. And am glad I have control. I am apparently a millennial. I want want want
